Article.Abstract: Amino acid residues 111-129 represent an immunodominant epitope of myelin basic protein (MBP) in humans with human leukocyte antigen (HLA)-DRB1*0401 allele(s). The MBP 111-129-specific T cell clone MS2-3C8 was repeatedly isolated from a patient with multiple sclerosis (MS), suggesting an involvement of MS2-3C8 T cells in the pathogenesis. To address the pathogenic potential of the MS2-3C8 T cell clone, we generated transgenic (Tg) mice expressing its T cell receptor and restriction element, HLA-DRB1*0401, to examine the pathogenic characteristics of MS2-3C8 Tg T cells by adoptive transfer into HLA-DRB1*0401 Tg mice. In addition to the ascending paralysis typical of experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis, mice displayed dysphagia due to restriction in jaw and tongue movements and abnormal gait. In accordance with the clinical phenotype, infiltrates of MS2-3C8 Tg T cells and inflammatory lesions were predominantly located in the brainstem and the cranial nerve roots in addition to the spinal cord and spinal nerve roots. Together, these data suggest a pathogenic role of MBP-specific T cells in inflammatory demyelination within the brainstem and cranial nerve roots during the progression of MS. This notion may help to explain the clinical and pathological heterogeneity of MS.
Article.ArticleTitle: Unique clinical and pathological features in HLA-DRB1*0401-restricted MBP 111-129-specific humanized TCR transgenic mice.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Neurology, Robert Wood Johnson Medical School, UMDNJ, 683 Hoes Ln., Piscataway, NJ 08854, USA.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Transgenic mice express the TCR from the epitope specific T cell clone derived from a MS patient. Generation of the T cell clone was described in the cited reference, Muraro et al, J Clin Invest: 100(2) 1997 [PMID: 9218510].

AdoptiveTransfer.AdoptiveTransferComments: Mus musculus HLA-DRB1*0401 Tg were adoptively transferred with cell type T cell CD4+.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Transfer of the epitope specific T cells caused EAE in recipient mice. In addition to the typical symptoms (ascending paralysis, dysphagia and abnormal gait), inflamatory lesions were observed in the brainstem, cranial nerve roots, spinal cord, and spinal nerve roots by histopathological and immunohistochemical analysis.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Transgenic mice express the TCR from the epitope specific T cell clone derived from a MS patient. Generation of the T cell clone was described in the cited reference, Muraro et al, J Clin Invest: 100(2) 1997 [PMID: 9218510].

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specific T cells proliferated in response to mouse MBP 111-129. The T cell line from the transgenic mouse was also tested with a high proliferation response. The splenocytes cultured directly ex vivo had a smaller response.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Transgenic mice express the TCR from the epitope specific T cell clone derived from a MS patient.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specific T cells secreted IL-4 in response to mouse MBP 111-129.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Transgenic mice express the TCR from the epitope specific T cell clone derived from a MS patient.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specific T cells secreted TNFα in response to mouse MBP 111-129.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specific T cells secreted IL-10 in response to mouse MBP 111-129.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs from a MS patient were isolated and stimulated in vitro to create the T cell clone. Generation of the T cell clone was described in the cited reference, Muraro et al, J Clin Invest: 100(2) 1997 [PMID: 9218510].

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specific T cells proliferated in response to mouse MBP 111-129.
